title: Digital Game-Based History Education Design: Mobile Microlearning Course

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in elementary history education and basic proficiency in digital device usage
context.additional_context: A course where in-service elementary teachers participate as practical developers of corporate history education content, operating in a smartphone-centric limited technology environment with project-based assessments to measure learning outcomes.

learning_goals: Learners can design historical education game scenarios by applying the 5-stage DGBL-ID model (Analysis-Design-Development-Quality Assurance-Implementation/Evaluation)
Learners can plan history concept delivery methods utilizing mobile-optimized quiz/simulation game mechanics
Learners can establish assessment systems measuring creative problem-solving abilities by developing game-based evaluation tools

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
